content.description: Excellent beginner toprope or lead route. Follows an offwidth splitter crack that is well-protected through several ledges. Crux is on finishing hand crack (classic move if you jam and avoid holds on the right face).
content.protection: #1 to #4 camalots, hexes, and large nuts. Ends at chain anchors
content.location: Farthest left route on the main wall.

content.description:
Probably the best sport route in Carbon County to date. Classic testpiece for the area. Pull out the lip of roof using a bat sequence followed by a bearhug sequence of open-handed liebacks (V6 crux). Continue through the remaining jug hauls with continuous pump to chains.

Open project. FA was only on TR thus far. Didn't have time to redpoint before relocating. Equipped and ready to lead.
content.protection: Stick clip 1st bolt at lip of roof. Then 5 more bolts to chains.
content.location: Just left of Seismic Smile through the steepest roof on main wall.

content.description: 2 cruxes of fairly continuous open handed mantling and pulling. Pretty fun route on solid stone.
content.location: Farthest right bolted route on main wall.

content.description: Stick clip and lie back into a beautiful quartzite dihedral and make your way to a ledge. Lean out to a large horizontal ledge (thin) and shoot straight up the face to chains. Pumpy.
content.location: On the left side of the arete from Tectonic Levitation

content.description: Stellar route on the best quartzite on the main wall. Super solid stone on mostly positive holds except for devious crux.
content.location: Just right of Tectonic. Starts under small roof and enters right facing shallow crack system. Proceed through tiers until encountering devious crux under large roof. Make your way to another pump crux out small roof to chains. Best route for the grade near Rawlins.
